text: This is what was given to the families of the people of Issachar, the cities with the towns around them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fifth name drawn was for the families of the people of Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: In their land were Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal. It spread west to Carmel and Shihor-libnath.
speaker: Narrator

text: It turned east to Beth-dagon and to Zebulun along the valley of Iphtahel north to Bethemek and Neiel. Then it went on north to Cabul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, as far as the big city of Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there the side of their land turned toward Ramah and then to the strong city of Tyre, turned again to Hosah, and ended at the sea near Achzib,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ummah, Aphek and Rehob. There were twenty-two cities with the towns around them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what was given to the families of the people of Asher, these cities with the towns around them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sixth name drawn was for the people of Naphtali, for the families of the people of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their land spread from Heleph, from the big tree in Zaanannim. It went through Adami-nekeb and Jabneel as far as Lakkum. And it ended at the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The side of their land turned from there west to Aznoth-tabor, and went on to Hukkok. It spread to Zebulun in the south, Asher in the west, and to Judah at the Jordan in the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: The strong cities were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedesh, Edrei, En-hazor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Yiron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh. There were nineteen cities with their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what was given to the families of the people of Naphtali, the cities with their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventh name drawn was for the families of the people of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: In their land were Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir-shemesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Me-jarkon and Rakkon, with the land near Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Dan needed more land. So they went up and fought with Leshem and took it with the sword. They took it for themselves and lived in it. And they gave it the name Leshem Dan after the name of Dan their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what was given to the families of the people of Dan, these cities with their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they finished dividing the land and giving to each family group their share, then the people of Israel gave some land among them to Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord had told them, they gave him the city he asked for. They gave him Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim. So he built the city and lived in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the land which was given by Eleazar the religious leader, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the houses of the families of the people of Israel. It was given by drawing names in Shiloh before the Lord at the door of the meeting tent. So they finished dividing the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Joshua,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘Choose the cities where you may go and be safe when you are in trouble, as I said to you through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the man who kills any person without meaning to or planning to may run to one of these cities. They will be places where you can go to be safe from the one who wants to punish you for the killing.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will run to one of these cities and stand at the city gate. There he will tell his story to the leaders of that city. They will take him into the city and give him a place. So he may live among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the one who wants to punish him comes after him, they will not give him the one who killed the person, because he killed his neighbor without planning to, and did not hate him in the past.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will live in that city until he has been tried in front of the people. And he will live there until the death of the one who is the head religious leader at the time. Then the one who killed the person may return to his own city and his own house, to the city he ran away from.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali. They set apart Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim. And they set apart Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the other side of the Jordan east of Jericho, they set apart Bezer in the desert plain from the family of Reuben. They set apart Ramoth in Gilead from the family of Gad. And they set apart Golan in Bashan from the family of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the chosen cities for all the people of Israel and for the stranger staying among them. So whoever killed any person without meaning to could run there. He could not be killed by the one who wanted to punish him, before standing trial in front of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the family heads of the Levites came to Eleazar the religious leader, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the family groups of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to them at Shiloh in Canaan, “The Lord said through Moses to give us cities to live in, as well as fields around them for our cattle.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Israel gave these cities and fields of their land to the Levites, as the Lord had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name drawn first was for the families of the Kohathites. The Levites who were children of Aaron the religious leader received thirteen cities from the families of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the sons of Kohath by drawing names received ten cities from the families of Ephraim and Dan and the half-family group of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gershon by drawing names received thirteen cities from the families of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali and the half-family group of Manasseh in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari received twelve cities from the families of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Israel by drawing names gave these cities with their fields to the Levites, as the Lord had said through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave from the families of Judah and Simeon the cities given here by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were for the sons of Aaron, one of the families of the Kohathites, of the sons of Levi. For their name was drawn first.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave them Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) with the fields around it in the hill country of Judah. (Arba was the father of Anak.)
speaker: Narrator

text: But the city’s fields and towns had been given to Caleb the son of Jephunneh as his own.
speaker: Narrator

text: So to the sons of Aaron the religious leader they gave Hebron and Libnah with their fields. Hebron was the city where one who killed a man could go to be safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave them Jattir with its fields, Eshtemoa with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Holon with its fields, Debir with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ain with its fields, Juttah with its fields, and Bethshemesh with its fields. There were nine cities from these two family groups.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the family of Benjamin were given Gibeon with its fields, Geba with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Anathoth with its fields, and Almon with its fields, four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sons of Aaron, the religious leaders, there were thirteen cities in all, with their fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then cities from the family of Ephraim were given to the rest of the families of the people of Kohath, the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave them Shechem with its fields in the hill country of Ephraim. A man who killed another person could run to Shechem to be safe. And they gave them Gezer with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kibzaim with its fields, and Beth-horon with its fields, four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the family of Dan were given Eletke with its fields, Gibbethon with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with its fields, and Gath-rimmon with its fields, four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the half-family group of Manasseh were given Taanach with its fields, and Gathrimmon with its fields, two cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were ten cities in all, with their fields, for the rest of the families of the Kohathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the half-family group of Manasseh they gave Golan in Bashan and Be-eshterah and their fields to the sons of Gershon, one of the Levite families. A man who killed another person could run to Golan in Bashan to be safe. They were given two cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the family of Issachar were given Kishion with its fields, Daberath with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth with its fields, and Engannim with its fields, four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the family of Asher were given Mishal with its fields, Abdon with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Helkath with its fields, and Rehob with its fields, four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the family of Naphtali were given Kedesh in Galilee with its fields, Hammoth-dor with its fields, and Kartan with its fields, three cities. A man who killed another man could run to Kedesh to be safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities for the families of the Gershonites were thirteen in all, with their fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave cities to the families of the sons of Merari, the rest of the Levites, from the family of Zebulun. They gave them Jokneam with its fields, Kartah with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dimnah with its fields, and Nahalal with its fields, four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the family of Reuben were given Bezer with its fields, Jahaz with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with its fields, and Mephaath with its fields, four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the family of Gad was given Ramoth in Gilead with its fields. A man who killed another person could run to Ramoth in Gilead to be safe. And they gave them Mahanaim with its fields,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with its fields, and Jazer with its fields, four cities in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were twelve cities in all given to the families of the people of Merari, the rest of the families of the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities of the Levites among the land of the people of Israel were forty-eight cities in all, with their fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each one of these cities had its fields around it. So it was with all these cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave Israel all the land He had promised to give to their fathers. They took it for their own, and lived in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave them peace on every side, just as He had promised their fathers. Not one of all those who hated them could stand in front of them. The Lord gave all those who hated them into their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every good promise which the Lord had made to the people of Israel came true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua called the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-family group of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “You have done all that the Lord’s servant Moses told you to do. You have obeyed me in all I have told you to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not left your brothers alone even to this day. But you have been careful to do what the Lord your God has told you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord your God has given rest to your brothers, as He promised them. So go now. Return to your homes in your own land, which the Lord’s servant Moses gave you on the other side of the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be very careful to obey the Law which the Lord’s servant Moses told you. Love the Lord your God. Walk in all His ways. Obey His Laws. Stay close to Him, and work for Him with all your heart and soul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua prayed that good would come to them, and sent them away. Then they went to their homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses had given land in Bashan to the half-family group of Manasseh. But Joshua gave land west of the Jordan to the other half of the family among their brothers. Joshua prayed that good would come to them when he sent them away to their homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Return to your homes with much riches, many animals, silver, gold, brass, iron, and very many clothes. Share with your brothers the riches taken from those who fought against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben and Gad and the half-family group of Manasseh returned home. They left the people of Israel at Shiloh in the land of Canaan and went to their own land of Gilead. They had taken this land by the word of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben and Gad and the half-family group of Manasseh came to the Jordan River. Before they crossed the Jordan, they built a very large altar on the Canaan side of the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Israel heard the news, “See, the people of Reuben and Gad and the half-family group of Manasseh have built an altar in the land of Canaan by the Jordan. It stands on the side that belongs to the people of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people of Israel heard about it, all the sons of Israel gathered at Shiloh to make war against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel sent Phinehas the son of the religious leader Eleazar into the land of Gilead to the people of Reuben and Gad and the half-family group of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: With him were ten leaders, one leader from each ruling house in every family of Israel. Each one was the head of his father’s house among the families of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to the people of Reuben and Gad and the half-family group of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, and said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “All the people of the Lord say, ‘What sin is this that you have done against the God of Israel? You have turned away from following the Lord this day, by building yourselves an altar. Today you have gone against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not the sin of Peor enough for us? We have made ourselves unclean from that to this day, and much trouble has come upon the people of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to add to that sin, this day you have turned away from following the Lord. If you go against the Lord today, He will be angry with all the people of Israel tomorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if the land you have been given is unclean, cross over into the Lord’s land. There stands the meeting tent of the Lord. Take land for yourselves among us. But do not go against the Lord, or against us, by building an altar other than the altar of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not Zerah’s son Achan sin by taking things that should have been destroyed? Anger came upon all the people of Israel. He did not die alone for his sin.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people of Reuben and Gad and the half-family group of Manasseh answered the leaders of the families of Israel, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Powerful One, the Lord, the Powerful One, God, the Lord! He knows! And may Israel itself know! If it was going against the Lord and not being faithful to Him, do not save us this day!
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have built an altar to turn away from following the Lord, or to give burnt gifts, grain gifts or peace gifts on it, may the Lord Himself punish us.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have done this because we were afraid that in time to come your children might say to our children, ‘What have you to do with the Lord, the God of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord has put the Jordan between us and you people of Reuben and Gad. You have nothing to do with the Lord.’ Then your children might make our children stop worshiping the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we said, ‘Let us build an altar. It will not be for burnt gifts or killing animals in worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it will be something special to be seen between us and you and our children after us. It will show that we are to serve the Lord before Him with our burnt gifts, our gifts of animals and our peace gifts. Then your children will not say to our children in the future, “You have nothing to do with the Lord.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: We thought that if they say this to us or our children in the future we can say, ‘See the altar we have made like the altar of the Lord which our fathers made. It is not for burnt gifts or killing animals in worship. But it is something special to see between us and you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Never let it be said that we went against the Lord and turned away from following the Lord this day by building an altar. It is not for burnt gifts or grain gifts or killing animals in worship. It is not to be used instead of the altar of the Lord our God before His meeting tent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas the religious leader and the leaders of the people, the heads of the families of Israel who were with him, were pleased when they heard the words of the people of Reuben, Gad and Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar the religious leader said to the people of Reuben, Gad and Manasseh, “Today we know that the Lord is among us. Because you have not done this as sin against the Lord. Now you have saved the people of Israel from the hand of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Phinehas the son of the religious leader Eleazar and the leaders left the people of Reuben and Gad. They returned from the land of Gilead to the people of Israel in the land of Canaan. And they told them what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: The news pleased the people of Israel, and they gave thanks to God. They said no more about going against them in war, to destroy the land where the people of Reuben and Gad were living.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Reuben and Gad said, “This altar shows the agreement between us that the Lord is God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A long time after that, the Lord had given Israel rest from all those around them who hated them. Joshua had grown old, and had lived many years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua called all Israel, their leaders, their heads, and the men chosen among them who judge between what is right or wrong. Then he said to them, “I am old and have lived many years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you have seen all the Lord your God has done to all these nations because of you. The Lord your God is the One Who has fought for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I have given to you as land for your families those nations that are left, with all the nations I have destroyed. They lie from the Jordan to the Great Sea in the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God will send them out from in front of you. He will send them away from you. Then their land will be yours, just as the Lord your God promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So do not be moved by others. Keep and obey all that is written in the book of the Law of Moses. Do not turn from it to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not mix with these nations that stay among you. Do not say the names of their gods or make anyone swear by them. Do not work for them or worship them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But hold on to the Lord your God, as you have done to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord has driven away large and strong nations from in front of you. No man has been able to stand in front of you to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of your men makes a thousand run away. For the Lord your God is the One Who fights for you, just as He promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be very careful to love the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you ever turn away and join the people of these nations left among you and marry some of their people and go among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: know for sure that the Lord your God will stop driving these nations away from you. And they will be a net and a trap to you. They will be a whip on your sides and thorns in your eyes, until you are destroyed from this good land the Lord your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, today I am going the way of all the earth. Know in all your hearts and in all your souls that not one of all the good promises the Lord your God made to you has been broken. All have come true for you. Not one of them has been broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every good promise the Lord your God made to you has come true. But in the same way, He will keep His promises to punish you. He will punish you until He has destroyed you from this good land the Lord your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you do not keep the agreement the Lord your God made with you, and serve other gods and worship them, then the anger of the Lord will burn against you and you will be destroyed from the good land He has given you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua gathered all the families of Israel to Shechem. He called for the leaders of Israel, the heads of the families and those who judged between what is right or wrong. And they showed themselves before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to all the people, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: ‘Long ago your fathers lived on the other side of the River. There was Terah, the father of Abraham and Nahor. And they worshiped other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I took your father Abraham from the other side of the River. I led him through all the land of Canaan. I gave him many children, and I gave him Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Mount Seir to Esau for his own. But Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent Moses and Aaron. I had to bring trouble upon Egypt by what I did among them. Then I brought you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: I brought your fathers out of Egypt to the Sea. Egypt went after your fathers to the Red Sea with war-wagons and horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they cried out to the Lord, He put darkness between you and the Egyptians. He brought the sea upon them and covered them. Your own eyes saw what I did in Egypt. And you lived in the desert for a long time.
speaker: Narrator

text: I brought you into the land of the Amorites who lived on the east side of the Jordan. They fought with you, and I gave them to you. You took their land for your own when I destroyed them in front of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: ’Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, came and fought against Israel. He sent for Balaam the son of Beor to curse you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I would not listen to Balaam. So he had to pray for good to come to you. And I saved you from his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: ’You crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho. The people of Jericho fought against you. And the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Girgashite, the Hivite and the Jebusite fought against you. So I gave them into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent the hornets ahead of you. They drove out the people and the two kings of the Amorites from in front of you. You did not do it by your sword or bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave you a land you did not work for. You live in cities you did not build. You are eating from vines and olive trees you did not plant.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So fear the Lord. Serve Him in faith and truth. Put away the gods your fathers served on the other side of the river and in Egypt. Serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you think it is wrong to serve the Lord, choose today whom you will serve. Choose the gods your fathers worshiped on the other side of the river, or choose the gods of the Amorites in whose land you are living. But as for me and my family, we will serve the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people answered, “May it never be that we turn away from the Lord and serve other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord our God is the One Who brought us and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, from the house where we were made to work. He did these powerful works in front of our eyes. He kept us safe everywhere we went, among all the nations we passed through.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord drove away from in front of us all the nations, even the Amorites who lived in the land. So we will serve the Lord. For He is our God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said to the people, “You will not be able to serve the Lord. For He is a holy God. He is a jealous God. He will not forgive your wrong-doing or your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you turn away from the Lord and serve strange gods, He will turn and punish you. He will destroy you after He has been good to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people said to Joshua, “Not so, for we will serve the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said to the people, “You have spoken for yourselves that you have chosen to serve the Lord.” And they said, “We have spoken for ourselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said, “So put away the strange gods that are among you. Give your hearts to the Lord, the God of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people said to Joshua, “We will serve the Lord our God. We will obey His voice.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua made an agreement with the people that day. And he made Laws for them in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua wrote these words in the book of the Law of God. Then he took a large stone and set it up there under the tree that was by the holy place of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to all the people, “See, this stone will be here to speak against us. For it has heard all the words the Lord spoke to us. So it will be here to speak against you, if you do not stay true to your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua sent the people away, each to his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Joshua the son of Nun, the Lord’s servant, died. He was 110 years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: They buried him in the land he was given in Timnath-serah, in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel served the Lord all the days of Joshua, and of the leaders who lived after him who had known all the works the Lord had done for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Israel brought the bones of Joseph from Egypt. They buried them in Shechem, in the piece of ground Jacob had bought from the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for 100 pieces of money. It became the land of Joseph’s children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar the son of Aaron died also. They buried him on the hill at Gibeah that was given to his son Phinehas in the hill country of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator
